alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough; Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 8:25PM EDT until July 12 at 1:59AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Contoocook River At Henniker affecting Merrimack and Hillsborough Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Sugar River At West Claremont affecting Sullivan County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Contoocook River at Henniker. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, In the town of Hillsborough, Hennicker Street and Bear Hill Road flood. In Henniker, flood waters encroach on parts of Western Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:31 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:31 PM EDT Tuesday was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain right around flood stage this evening, and then fall to 9.2 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
